page.title: 04Kirtlington Park
page.content: Kirtlington Park is surrounded by trees and the remains of a wall. There is a big house in the park and it was built in 1741/48. At the moment Mr. Buxton owns it and lives in part of it. The rest is rented to other people. There is also a polo ground which has games most Sundays between May and September. Most years Prince Charles comes to play. Every year there are several fox hunts. On the edge of the park is a lake about 2.5 acres in size. The park covers 274 acres of landscape. It is not open to the public. The first people to live in Kirtlington Park were Sir James and Lady Dashwood and their family. Sir James must have been very rich because his house was one of the finest in the county. At the entrance to the park are two stylish green gates. The park is mainly grazing land for cattle and horses.
